trans-unit.source: An abstract base class for a collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> objects.
A ServiceModel extension element.
Adds the specified element to this configuration section.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> to be added.
element is `null`.
The configuration file is read-only.
element already exists in the collection.
-or-
The element type specified by element is not permitted.
Adds a new behavior element to this section and returns a value that indicates whether the operation is successful.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> to be added.
`true` if the operation is successful; otherwise, `false`.
element is `null`.
Deletes all elements in this collection.
This method cannot be inherited.
This method empties the collection and resets its <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionCollectionElement%601.Count%2A> property to 0.
The configuration file is read-only.
Returns a value that indicates whether this collection contains a specific element.
This method cannot be inherited.
The element to look for.
`true` if the collection contains the specified element; otherwise, `false`.
element is `null`.
Determines whether this collection contains an element of the specified name.
The name of the element to search for.
`true` if the collection contains an element of the specified name; otherwise, `false`.
elementName is `null`.
Determines whether this collection contains an element of the specified type.
The type of the element to search for.
`true` if the collection contains an element of the specified type; otherwise, `false`.
elementName is `null`.
Copies the entire collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
This method cannot be inherited.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from collection.
The array must have zero-based
The zero-based index in the elements array at which copying begins.
element is `null`.
start is invalid.
Gets the number of items in this collection.
The number of items in this collection.
Reads XML from the configuration file.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> that reads from the configuration file.
`true` to serialize only the collection key properties; otherwise, `false`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that iterates through a collection.
This method cannot be inherited.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Indicates whether this configuration element has been modified since it was last saved or loaded, when implemented in a derived class.
This method determines whether this object is written to the configuration file.
If the return value is `false`, it is assumed that the configuration file represents the current state of the element.
By default, this property returns `true` after a property is set through the indexer to this object.
You should override this method to provide custom indication of the state of this element.
`true` if the element has been modified; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the item of the specified type within the collection.
The type of the item in the collection to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> that represents the item located at the specified index within the collection.
extensionType is `null`.
extensionType is invalid.
Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.
The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionElement"></xref> that represents the item located at the specified index within the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether an unknown element is encountered during deserialization.
The name of the unknown sub-element.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> being used for deserialization.
`true` when an unknown element is encountered while deserializing; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection"></xref> instance that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty"></xref> objects that can be attributes or <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> objects of this configuration element.

A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection"></xref> instance that contains a collection of <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty"></xref> objects that can be attributes or <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> objects of this configuration element.
Removes the specified element from the collection.
This method cannot be inherited.
The element to be removed from the collection.
`true` if the element is successfully found and removed; otherwise, `false`.
This method returns `false` if the element is not found in the collection.
element is `null`.
Resets this collection to its unmodified state when overridden in a derived class.
The default behavior for this method is to clear any modified elements a collection contains and to set the modified elements to the values specified by their parent configuration file.
If any element in the collection has child elements, this method is also called on those child elements.
The parent <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> object of the current element, or `null` if this is the top level.
Resets the value of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionCollectionElement`1.IsModified"></xref> property to `false` when overridden in a derived class.
This method determines whether the elements of this collection is written to the configuration file when the configuration is updated.
Sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionCollectionElement`1.IsModified"></xref> property for this collection.
Sets the internal `IsReadOnly` property for this collection and for all sub-elements.
Reverses the effect of merging configuration information from different levels of the configuration hierarchy.
This method reverses the effect of merging configuration information from different levels of the configuration hierarchy.
This allows configuration set at the current hierarchy level to be differentiated from that set at parent levels, before serialization.
This method is called by the system on a new temporary element to compare the parent object and the source object.
Based on the `saveMode` value, it then sets the temporary object to contain the data that must be serialized.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] save modes, see <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode.Minimal>.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> object at the current level that contains a merged view of the properties.
The parent <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement"></xref> object of the current element, or `null` if this is the top level.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode"></xref> enumerated value that determines which property values to include.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionCollectionElement`1"></xref> is read-only.
A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceModelExtensionCollectionElement`1"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that iterates through a collection.
This method cannot be inherited.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
